content: The Act titled "Commercial Fishermen Safety and Tax Fairness Act of 2000" allows income averaging for fishermen. The Act "Commercial Fishermen Safety and Tax Fairness Act of 2000" allows income averaging for fishermen by amending the Internal Revenue Code to include fishing businesses in the definition of elected farm income. The definition of "fishing business" is amended to include commercial fishing activities as defined in the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act. SEC. 3. CREDIT FOR PURCHASE OF FISHING SAFETY EQUIPMENT. An amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 introduces a new section, SEC. 45D, which provides a credit for the purchase of fishing safety equipment. The new section SEC. 45D offers a fishing safety equipment credit to eligible taxpayers engaged in a fishing business. The credit is 75% of qualified expenses, capped at $1,500 per year. The term 'eligible taxpayer' refers to a taxpayer involved in a fishing business. Qualified fishing safety equipment expenses include amounts paid for lifesaving equipment required on vessels. The section discusses rules for vessels under title 46, United States Code, including aggregation rules for employers. It also states that no double benefit deduction is allowed for amounts used to determine a credit under this section. The section discusses rules for vessels under title 46, United States Code, including aggregation rules for employers. No double benefit deduction is allowed for amounts used to determine a credit under this section. A credit allowed under this section will result in a basis adjustment for the equipment. There is a limitation on carryback of the fishing safety equipment credit before the effective date. No carryback of fishing safety equipment credit before effective date. Conforming amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 related to the fishing safety equipment credit under section 45D. It includes changes to subsection (a) of section 1016 regarding equipment eligible for the credit. The text chunk amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding the fishing safety equipment credit under section 45D, including a clerical amendment to the table of sections. The fishing safety equipment credit under section 45D is amended by this Act, with an effective date for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2000.
